artist_books.general_description: Hand printed, signed and bound by the artist. Printed onto Somerset velvet paper 250 gms with archival inks. Sequential narrative storytelling.

items.title: Gods & Monsters
items.medium: Linocut, wood block & Letterpress, hardback cover concertina book
items.narrative: A large format alphabet book illustrating surreal creatures and spiritual powers. Inspired by Ovid’s Metamorphosis and Greek Mythology. Themes: fusion of villain and hero, passage of life, good versus evil.

items.title: Journeyman
items.medium: Etching & Letterpress, hardback cover concertina book
items.narrative: Inspired by a surreal dream. The labyrinth represents the twists and turns of modern life. Symbols: jellyfish, dream catcher. Themes: life’s excitements, fears and dangers.

items.title: Run
items.medium: Linocut, Letterpress, and collage, ½ bound hardback cover
items.narrative: Exploration of sayings/expressions. Machines are taking over. Glances at how media runs news and politicians run lives. Themes: Technology, corruption.

items.title: Future
items.medium: Linocut, Letterpress, and collage, hardback cover
items.narrative: Created in a time of uncertainty. Parallels between superpowers (Kim Jong-un, Trump, Putin). Themes: Nuclear threat, greed, power corruption. 'The Future is now.'

items.title: Crack’s Progress / Charlie’s Progress
items.medium: Offset lithograph from linocuts, hardback cover dos a dos book
items.narrative: Two tales in one. Crack's Progress: A modern fable of drugs and crime based on Hogarth. Charlie's Progress: Follows Crack's sister through London's low life and exploitation.

items.title: Modern Marriage
items.narrative: Interweaves the 'Progress' stories. Tara and Darren marry. Themes: Debt, crime, neglect, tragedy, and redemption through siblings Crack and Charlie.

items.title: Contemporary Street Alphabet
items.narrative: An alphabet book of modern-day street characters. A savage portrayal of the city, depicting victims and perpetrators.

ceramics.general_description: Sculptural forms in stoneware clay with brush-on slips, glazes, and oxides. Unique storytelling experiences.

items.title: Afterlife
items.narrative: Inspired by Day of the Dead. Skeletons act as gatekeepers to the afterlife.

items.title: Azrael
items.narrative: Angel of death, keeper of fire. Linking into the Inferno series.

items.title: Bala
items.narrative: The next terrible storm is named. Spinning and raging.

items.title: Burn in hell
items.narrative: Links to Inferno prints. Witches, boiling water, trapped souls.

items.title: Chaos
items.narrative: Creation and destruction. Swirling wind, rising sea levels.

items.title: Lockdown
items.narrative: Characters incarcerated in El Salvador prisons. Violence, betrayal.

items.title: Superpowers
items.narrative: Political spats, social media, fake news, nuclear buttons.

items.title: Medusa
items.narrative: Medusa's gaze. Open mouths invite consumption. 'Hell on a plate'.

items.title: Rocket man
items.narrative: Reference to Hiroshima bombs and modern ego threats of superpowers.

items.title: Safe passage
items.narrative: The ferry man guides souls through darkness closer to hell.

items.title: Fish car
items.narrative: Genetic manipulation. A hybrid that can't run or swim.

items.title: Freedom
items.narrative: The war has ended, but wounds are open. Freedom must prevail.

print_collections.description: Explores the darker sides of human nature, impact on the planet, political events, and manmade catastrophes. References Dante’s Inferno.

works.title: The War: A Reflection on Power, and Survival
works.narrative: A stark and urgent reminder of turbulent times. Echoes German Expressionism. Explores cycles of violence, power-hungry leaders, and the threat of total annihilation. Imagery of underground tunnels serves as a metaphor for survival and control. 'Who will push the red button?' A visual manifesto for resistance.

works.title: Night Attack
works.narrative: The lords on high soar in the skies, ready to pounce. 'Run: don’t look up.' Death is coming for all; even while the carnival proceeds, all will succumb.

works.title: Night Terrors
works.narrative: The guardian angel swoops down. No Mercy, no Forgiveness. Bodies pile up. The death stare of Azrael is relentless; you may fight, but ultimately fail.

works.title: Midnight
works.narrative: Displaced and distraught people move during the cover of night. The sound of war rumbles, explosions shatter windows. Judgement dawns with a new day, but night demons still hunt. Air raid sirens wail.

works.title: The FUTURE
works.narrative: Post-apocalyptic narrative. Rising sea levels, human consumption. 'The FUTURE is now!'

works.title: Fall
works.narrative: Prediction of societal collapse. 'Fall, Fall, we will all fall'. Economies fail, pandemics rise.

works.title: Hell is empty: the devils are all here
works.narrative: Maybe the devils are us? Religion and politics blind us. Rise above the darkness.

works.title: Swamp of indulgent consequences
works.narrative: Earth groans under weight of 'things'. Putrid swamps, storms named after lusts.

works.title: Stewpot of Mouldering Morsels
works.narrative: Food mouldering past sell by dates. The stench of corrupted food cycles.

works.title: Hell on Earth
works.narrative: Masked officials infiltrate. 'Hell on Earth is now and for ever'.

works.title: The Devils in the Detail
works.narrative: We deal with the devils daily. Consumption corrodes the planet.

works.title: Descent into Darkness
works.narrative: The tree as a gateway to the graveyard.

works.title: The circles of Hell
works.narrative: Work in progress. Inspired by Dante. A lone journeyman wanders through the labyrinth.

print_collections.description: Exploration of the conflict between Man and Machine, AI, and authoritarian control.

works.title: Revolution
works.narrative: The iron machine strides forward to destroy. Man v Machine. AI assists the iron machine. Big Brother is watching. An uprising is emerging.

works.title: Metamorph
works.narrative: He transforms and appears to greet his audience, but the Monster is revealed. Command and conquer. Twisted iron entraps buildings. No one is safe when the monsters return.

print_collections.description: Evocative prints focusing on place, memory, and atmosphere.

works.title: Cromer
works.narrative: Nostalgia for a place by the sea. Crashing waves, smell of fish and chips, excited children. Architectural grandeur standing strong against North Sea winds. The pier as a statement of British character.

print_collections.description: Inhabitants of towns/cities, living in light or lurking in shadows. Themes of urban decay, corruption, and vice.
Inspired by Hogarth. Charlie's journey through London.

works.title: Conceived in a summer of love
To be safe in the city

print_collections.description: A modern fable of dark morality, crime and corruption.

works.title: To be bad he became bad
